article.headline: San Francisco 68, Loyola Marymount 61 (OT)
article.story: LOS ANGELES (AP) -- Armondo Surratt scored 18 points and Antonio Kellogg had 15 points and eight rebounds as San Francisco beat Loyola Marymount 68-61 in overtime Saturday night. The Dons (6-11, 2-0 West Coast Conference) went 5-for-7 from the field and outscored the Lions (8-11, 0-3) 15-8 in the extra period for their second-straight overtime victory. San Francisco held Loyola Marymount to one basket in OT and snapped a four game losing streak to the Lions. Matthew Knight had 20 points and 10 rebounds and Damian Martin had 16 points, 14 rebounds and five steals for Loyola Marymount, but the Lions shot just 37.3 percent as a team. Knight scored eight points in a 9-0 Lions run over the final six minutes of regulation to send the game into overtime. Loyola Marymount has lost six straight.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
